intro: Petalostelma cearense, commonly known as the Ceará petalostelma, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
